noun.description: The attainment or acquisition of a position of rank or power, typically that of monarch or president.
examples: the Queen's accession to the throne
lost the vote on the Fortas accession to the chief justiceship

noun.description: A new item added to an existing collection of books, paintings, or artifacts.

verb.description: Record the addition of (a new item) to a library, museum, or other collection.

origin: Late 16th century (in the general sense something added): from Latin accessio(n-), from the verb accedere approach, come to (see accede).
